episode_summary: This episode covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the edibility and uses of loofahs, the creation of the game Jumanji as a response to a dislike of Monopoly, the isolation of an uncontacted tribe member in Brazil, and historical rights to human waste in 19th century Osaka.

facts.fact: The man who invented Jumanji did so because he hated Monopoly.
There is a man in Brazil who nobody is allowed to go within five miles of.
In 19th century Osaka, flat residents owned the rights to their own urine, but the rights to their poo belonged to their landlord.
